converse.line: Hello, dear.
Hey. I'm just stopping by.

random.line: Would you care for a cup of tea?
I am kind of thirsty. What kind do you have?
Peach, peppermint, elf dust, star powder, and some other flavors.
Oh, yes. Those are... exotic flavors like... apple and raspberry with different names.
Okay, I'll have star powder then.
Those are nice earrings. They remind me of herculean crystals.
I don't think I've heard of those before.
Oh, um. They are... crystals found in caves. They're really pretty.

converse.line: Hello.
Hi, dear. Make yourself at home.
Thank you.
That is a nice dress. Is it spun out of celestial spider silk?
What?
Oh, um. You know... it's a fancy way of saying... cotton, yes. It's an old expression, sorry.
...forgive me for asking, but do you practice magic?
Shhhhh! We don't mention that here! Especially where others can hear. Come closer.
How did you find out?
You were acting strange. But, I was looking for a witch anyways. Can you help me?
If you promise not to tell anyone who I am, I'll do what I can. Being a witch is heresy, especially in this town. I need to keep this top secret.
You have my word. I need a potion that can transform a dog back into a human.
Oooh. That's a tricky one. And it requires a lot of ingredients which I don't have. I'd be happy to brew it for you if you get the ingredients I don't have.
Sounds like a deal.
Okay. Here's a list of items needed for the potion. Good luck finding them.
Oh, I almost forgot. One of the items on the list is to get someone with a good voice to sing the "Song of Transformation" and record it to CD. I'll also give you the lyrics sheet for that.
You don't have all the ingredients yet. Consult the recipe I gave you.
I have all the ingredients.
Perfect. I'll get cracking on the potion. Wait here.
30 minutes later...
...she's alone. And she is free...
15 minutes later...
All done! Here you go! Remember to promise not to tell anybody.
Are the effects permanent and instantaneous?
Yes and yes. Don't worry. I wouldn't have tricked you.
You use the potion yet?

choice.line: I can summon creatures, create potions, and control the power of the flame.
Whoa, can I see a demonstration?
No. That might attract attention. I'm still under cover, remember?
Where did you learn magical arts from?

I wasn't taught by anyone. You see, magic can only be learned by outcasts. People with little interaction with others. When I first discovered my power, I thought I was hallucinating. Later I found out it was real when someone else saw it by accident. As I tried more things, I learned more. I never told anyone, because the punishment for being found using magic is death. People don't like us magic users having an advantage in life.
That's unfair. You guys should be treated like queens for having that power.
Sadly, that's not the way the world is run.
